senses.de: to be responsible for something or someone
senses.ex: She is in charge of the marketing department.
senses.sy: responsible for, in control of, in command of
cl: be in charge of a project
be in charge of a team
be in charge of a department

Tips.title: Formal Context
Tips.description: Use this phrase in formal settings, such as business or academic contexts.
Tips.example: The CEO is in charge of the entire company.

Responsible for.wordDefinition: Similar to 'be in charge of', but often used in a less formal context.
